definition: to send/to mail/to entrust/to depend on/to attach oneself to/to live (in a house)/to lodge/foster (son etc)
to exist/to deposit/to store/to keep/to survive
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point

sentences.english: I need to put it in the cloak-room.
sentences.chinese: 我需要把这寄放在寄存处。

sentences.english: He deposited the case in the left luggage office.
sentences.chinese: 他把箱子放在行李寄存处。

sentences.english: Would you please deposit your bag at the check room?
sentences.chinese: 请把您的包放在寄存处好吗？

sentences.english: I want to deposite my case in the left luggage office.
sentences.chinese: 我想把箱子放在行李寄存处。

sentences.english: Please leave your bag at the cloak-room.
Sorry, there is not baggage deposit office in the airport.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉，机场里没有行李寄存处。

sentences.english: The check room is just behind the front door.
Please leave your belongings (except for valuables) to the cloakroom.
sentences.chinese: 除贵重物品外，其他物品请在寄存处存放。

definition: to deposit/to store/to leave sth with sb
luggage that has been checked in (on flight)
to inspect a ticket/to examine a ballot
